revision.comment: Parsecboy moved page [[French submarine Pluviôse (Q51)]] to [[French submarine Pluviôse]]: no other ships with this name, dab is unnecessary
revision.text:
{|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[File:Le Pluviose Q51.png|300px]] |Ship caption=French submarine ''Pluviôse'' in [[Boulogne]] harbour }} {{Infobox ship career |Hide header= |Ship country=France |Ship flag={{shipboxflag|France|naval}} |Ship name=''Pluviôse'' |Ship namesake=The month of [[Pluviôse]] |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=Arsenal de [[Cherbourg]] |Ship laid down= |Ship launched=27 May 1907 |Ship commissioned=10 May 1908 |Ship stricken=1919 |Ship fate=*Sunk in collision, 26 May 1910, [[Marine salvage|raised]] and returned to service |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption=(as built) |Ship class={{sclass-|Pluviôse|submarine}} |Ship displacement=*{{Convert|404|t|LT|0|abbr=on}} (surfaced) * {{Convert|553|t|LT|0|abbr=on}} (submerged) |Ship length={{convert|51.12|m|ftin|abbr=on}} ([[o/a]]) |Ship beam={{convert|4.96|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship draft={{convert|3.15|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |Ship power=*{{convert|700|PS|kW bhp|lk=on|abbr=on}} (steam) * 2 × [[Du Temple boiler]] * {{convert|400|PS|kW bhp|abbr=on}} (electric motors) |Ship propulsion=*2 × shafts; 2 × [[Marine steam engine#Triple or multiple expansion|Triple-expansion steam engines]]s * 2 × [[electric motor]]s |Ship speed=*{{convert|12|kn|lk=in}} (surfaced) * {{convert|8|kn}} (submerged) |Ship range=*{{convert|1000|nmi|abbr=on|lk=in}} at {{convert|8.5|kn}} (surfaced) * {{convert|27|nmi|abbr=on}} at {{convert|5|kn}} (submerged) |Ship test depth= |Ship complement=2 officers and 23 crewmen |Ship armament=*1 × {{convert|450|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} bow [[torpedo tube]] *1 × twin 450 mm [[Drzewiecki drop collar]] *4 × external 450 mm torpedo launchers (2 × facing forward, 2 × aft) }} |}
'''French submarine ''Pluviôse'' (Q51)''' was a [[Maxime Laubeuf|Laubeuf]] type submarine<ref name=Jane>Jane p199</ref> built for the [[French Navy]] prior to [[World War I]]. She was the [[name ship]] of [[Pluviôse-class submarine|her class]].<ref name=Conway>Conway p209</ref>
==Design and construction== ''Pluviôse'' was ordered by the French Navy as part of its 1905 programme and was laid down at the [[Arsenal de Cherbourg|Cherbourg Naval Yard]] in November of that year. She was launched on 27 May 1907 and commissioned 10 May 1908. ''Pluviôse'' was equipped with [[Félix du Temple|Du Temple]] boilers and reciprocating steam engines for surface propulsion, and [[General Electric Company, Nancy|CGE Nancy]] electric motors for power while submerged. She carried eight torpedoes, two internally and six externally.<ref name=Conway/> ''Pluviôse'' was named for [[Pluviose|a month]] of the [[French Revolutionary calendar]].
==Service history== On the afternoon of 26 May 1910 ''Pluviôse'' was cruising off [[Calais]] when she was involved in a collision with the packet boat ''Pas de Calais''. ''Pluviôse'' sank with the loss of all hands, 27 men. The vessel was later raised and repaired, though she was not returned to front-line service, being disarmed and used for compression tests.
Her captain at the time of the accident Maurice Callot, was later honoured by having [[French submarine Maurice Callot|a submarine named after him]].
''Pluviôse'' was stricken in 1919 and sold for scrap in 1925.
==Notes== {{reflist|30em}}
